Texto: 
patient was tachypnic and pale.  her oxygen saturation was 93% on room air.  lab work showed a hematocrit and hemoglobin of 4.5 and 15.7, respectively.  her coagulation studies were normal.  blood gas showed a po2 of 55.
patient was anticoagulated with heparin and coumadin for treatment of her pulmonary embolus.
a ct pe/dvt protocol was initially performed following transfusion of 3 units of blood.   the study was limited secondary to patient’s respiratory motion.  a questionable filling defect was thought to be
pulmonary embolus
pulmonary embolus
84 year old woman with past medical history significant for depression, presented to the pulmonology clinic with 2-3 month history of fatigue which had increased in the last 2-3 weeks.  patient also reported increased difficulty breathing.
